meanings.definition: An ancient Roman assembly for electing officials and passing laws.
meanings.sent1: The comitia in ancient Rome gathered to choose leaders and make rules.
meanings.sent2: The comitia was held to select new leaders and decide on laws.
meanings.sent3: At the comitia, they probably voted on what to have for lunch!
meanings.sent4: The comitia was a powerful tool, shaping the future of the Roman Republic.
meanings.sent5: In the comitia, the voices of the people echoed through the marble halls.

meanings.definition: A public meeting or assembly, especially for voting.
meanings.sent1: The town comitia met to discuss important matters and cast their votes.
meanings.sent2: During the comitia, citizens gathered to vote on community issues.
meanings.sent3: The comitia turned into a lively debate about the best ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent4: In the comitia, every ballot represented a voice in the decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The comitia buzzed with energy as people shared their opinions and made choices.
